properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NSW Health Vaccination Centre – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre is in operation on Monday - Saturdays from 8am to 8pm daily for those with confirmed appointments only. 

The centre will begin operating on Sundays from 9am to 4pm for around 6 weeks from Sunday 27 June. 

The nearest available parking is at P3 Car park on Sarah Durack Ave. Follow signage to walk to the centre, or catch the shuttle bus.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

properties.headline: State of Origin - Wednesday 14 July - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Route 525 and 526 buses will be diverting around closures in Sydney Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
State of Origin Game III at Stadium Australia, Olympic Park. Gates open from 5pm. Kick-off from 8:10pm. 

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to Olympic Park during the already busy Wednesday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on major roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Roads in the precinct will start closing from as early as 9am on game day including sections of Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Dawn Fraser Ave and other local roads. Most roads remain closed until 2am Thursday 15 July.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm Tuesday 13 July).

properties.headline: Sutherland 2 Surf - Sunday 18 July - SUTHERLAND TO CRONULLA via the Kingsway
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting around the closures. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 7,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.30am, with all roads reopened by 11am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd.
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10.30am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.50am. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the Kingsway westbound lanes from 7am, delays are expected.
  • Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave.
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde and Oak Rd. The Kingsway will be closed in both directions between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy from 7.20am to 8.50am.
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave and Yathong Rd.
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7:30am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd.
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St.
  • Cronulla from 5am: Mitchell Rd, Elouera Rd and Prince St. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 10.20am access to North Cronulla access is via Captain Cook Dr and access to South Cronulla access is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd.

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Milburn Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 4pm Sat 17 July until midday Sun 18 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
From 4pm Saturday 17 July to 12 Midday Sunday 18 July: Greenhills Beach car park from the corner of Mitchell Road and Murdock Street, Cronulla.

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections at:

  • Sylvania Road before 7:20am and after 8:50am

  • Gannons Road before 7:40am and after 9:55am
arrangementElements.title: Kingsway crossover points

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 2 July - PENRITH Mulgoa Road, Jamison Road at BlueBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Eels at BlueBet Stadium. Kick off from 7.55pm, full-time around 9.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the game during the busy Friday evening peak.

Fans should allow extra time as parking is limited in the area and will be in high demand.

properties.headline: Music festival - Thursday 1 July to Sunday 18 July - SYDNEY Art Gallery Road at Hospital Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Winter in the Domain concert series at the Phillip Precinct. Start and finish times vary between Thursday 1 July and Sunday 18 July.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in the CBD approaching The Domain as fans travel to and from the concerts, particularly during the weekday evening peaks. There are no internal or external planned road closures.

Fans travelling by rideshare or taxi should allow extra travel time and plan to get there early. An event drop off zone will be located on Hospital Road.
properties.displayName: Music festival - Thursday 1 July to Sunday 18 July

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 2 July - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Warriors v Dragons at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford. Kick off from 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game Friday evening. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 4pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - Saturday 3 July - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Sea Eagles at Bankwest Stadium from 3pm until 5pm approx.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL -  Saturday 3 July - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Cowboys at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick off from 7:35pm, full-time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - Sunday 4 July - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Rabbitohs from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event during Sunday afternoon.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Special event - Tuesday 29 and Wednesday 30 June - NELSON BAY Nelson Bay Road approaching Tomaree Sport Complex
properties.otherAdvice:
The Peter Wilson Memorial Touch Championships 2021 will be taking place at Tomaree Sport Complex on Tuesday 29 and Wednesday 30 June from 6am until 6pm. 

Nelson Bay Rd approaching the event site may be busier than usual as attendees and spectators travel to and from the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.
properties.displayName: Special event - Tuesday 29 and Wednesday 30 June

properties.headline: NRL -  Thursday 1 July - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Storm at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick off from 7:50pm, full-time around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium during evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Boat Parade - Saturday 26 June - WARNERS BAY The Esplanade, Macquarie Drive and Ross Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Float Your Boat flotilla parade will take place along the shore from Warners Bay to Belmont on Saturday evening. 

Traffic will be heavier that usual along The Esplanade at Warners Bay, Macquarie Dr at Eleebana, Macquarie Dr at Croudace Bay and Ross St at Belmont. Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the Lake Macquarie the area.

roads.mainStreet: The Esplanade, Macquarie Drive and Ross Street

properties.headline: Special event - Friday 25 June - NEWCASTLE King Street between Auckland Street AND Darby Street
properties.otherAdvice:
A civic ceremony is taking place at Newcastle City Hall on Friday 25 June.

King St will be closed between Auckland St and Darby St between 4am and 3pm. Traffic will be detoured in both directions via Auckland St, Hunter St and Darby St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.
